record.title: COMMENDING WALTER LUTHERAN HIGH SCHOOL, AUSTIN POLYTECHNICAL HIGH SCHOOL, AND RICHARD T. CRANE HIGH SCHOOL
record.narrative:
COMMENDING WALTER LUTHERAN HIGH SCHOOL, AUSTIN POLYTECHNICAL HIGH SCHOOL, AND RICHARD T. CRANE HIGH SCHOOL -- (House of Representatives - June 03, 2008)

[Page: H4836]
(Mr. DAVIS of Illinois asked and was given permission to address the House for 1 minute and to revise and extend his remarks.)

speaking.paragraph: Mr. Speaker, over the weekend I had the opportunity to visit three schools in my congressional district, and I want to take the opportunity to commend and congratulate all three of them.

The Walter Lutheran High School in Melrose Park, Illinois, where I attended their graduation Sunday, and I was pleased that my nephew Dante Davis was one of the graduates; then the Austin Polytechnical High School, which focuses on manufacturing, in Chicago yesterday; and last night I had a town hall meeting at the Richard T. Crane High School in Chicago on stopping school violence.
All of them are outstanding, and I commend them.
